quiz.text: An inlet pipe fills 1/8th part of a tank in 1 h. How much time will the pipe take to fill the empty tank?
options: 4h
2h
6h
8h
None of these

quiz.text: There are two taps A and B to fill up a water tank. The tank can be filled in 40 min, if both taps are on. The same tank can be filled in 60 min, if tap A alone is on. How much time will tap B alone take, to fill up the same tank?
options: 64 min
80 min
96 min
120 min
None of these

quiz.text: Three taps are fitted in a cistern. The empty cistern is filled by the first and the second taps in 3h and 4h, respectively. The full cistern is emptied by the third tap in 5 h. If all three taps are opened simultaneously, the empty cistern will be filled up in?
options: 1(14/23) h
2(14/23) h
2 h 40 min
1 h 56 min
None of these

quiz.text: Pipe A can fill a tank in 30 min, while pipe B can fill the same tank in 10 min and pipe C can empty the full tank in 40 min. If all the pipes are opened together, how much time will be needed to make the tank full?
options: 9(3/13) h
9(4/13) h
9(7/13) h
9(9/13)h
None of these

quiz.text: Two pipes A and B can fill a tank in 1 h and 75 min, respectively. There is also an outlet C. If all the three pipes are opened together. The tank is full in 50 min. How much time will be taken by C to empty the full tank?
options: 100 min
150 min
200 min
125 min
None of these

quiz.text: A, B and C are three pipes connected to a tank. A and B together fill the tank in 6 h, B and C together fill the tank in 10 h and A and C together fill the tank in 12 h. In how much time A, B and C fill up the tank together?
options: 9 h
5(3/7) h
5(2/7) h
5(5/7) h
None of these

quiz.text: Inlet A is four times faster than inlet B to fill a tank. If A alone can fill it in 15 min, how long will it take if both the pipes are opened together?
options: 10 min
12 min
15 min
14 min
None of these

quiz.text: There are two inlets A and B connected to a tank. A and B can fill the tank in 16 h and 10 h, respectively. If both the pipes are opened alternately for 1 h, starting from A, then how much time will the tank take to be filled?
options: 13(1/4) h
11(6/8)h
12(2/5)h
12(1/4)h
None of these

quiz.text: A water tank is 2/3th full. Pipe A can fill the tank in 10 minutes and the pipe B can empty it in 6 minutes. If both the pipes are open, how long will it take to empty or fill the tank completely?
options: 6 minutes to empty
6 minutes to fill
9 minutes to empty
9 minutes to fill
None of these

quiz.text: Two pipes A and B can fill a cistern in 20 minutes and 25 minutes respectively. Both are opened together, but at the end of 5 minutes, B is turned off. How much longer will the cistern take to fill?
options: 16 minutes
18 minutes
11 minutes
C.N.D.
None of these

quiz.text: 12 pumps working 6 hours a day can empty a completely filled reservoir in 15 days. How many such pumps working 9 hours a day will empty the same reservoir in 12 days?
options: 15
9
10
12
None of these

quiz.text: A pipe can fill any tank with water in 5 hours and an another pipe can empty the same tank in 4 hours. If the tank is completely filled and both the taps are opened together than the tank will be empty in following time (hour)?
options: 9
18
20
20.5
None of these

quiz.text: Two pipes can fill a tank respectively in 15 and 12 hours while a third pipe can empty it in 20 hours. If the tank is empty and all three pipes are opened together then in how much time will it take to fill the tank completely?
options: 10 hours
5 hours
15 hours
20 hours
None of these

quiz.text: A big tanker can be filled by two pipes A and B respectively in 60 and 40 min. Then what time it will take to fill an empty tanker if tap B is used half of time and tap A and B together are used rest half of time?
options: 24 min
30 min
18 min
32 min
None of these

quiz.text: Two taps A and B can fill an oil tank in respectively 15 min and 18 min while a third tap is used to empty the tank. The third tap is opened after 6 min of opening of tap A and B. If the tank empties  16.5 min after opening the third tap then in how much time the third tap can empty the full tank?
options: 6 min
12 min
10 min
15 min
None of these

quiz.text: A water tank has three taps A, B, C. Tap A, when opened, can fill the water tank alone in 4 hours. Tap B, when opened, can filled the water tank alone in 6 hours and tap C, when opened, can empty the water tank alone in 3 hours. If taps A, B and C are opened simultaneously how long will it take to fill the tank completely?
options: 10 hours
8 hours
18 hours
12 hours
None of these

quiz.text: 18 pumps can fill reservoir of capacity 1440 kiloliter in 5 hours. Then how many hours required to fill a reservoir of capacity 1920 kilo liter by 8 pumps?
options: 10 hours
16 hours
15 hours
20 hours
None of these

quiz.text: Inlet A is four times faster than inlet B to fill a tank. If A alone can fill it in 15 min, how long will it take if both the pipes are opened together?
options: 10 min
12 min
15 min
14 min
None of these

quiz.text: A tank has a leak which would empty it in 8 hrs. A tap is turned on which admits 6 litres a minutes into the tank, and it is now emptied in 12 hrs. How many litres does the tank hold?
options: 8260 litres
8450 litres
8640 litres
8660 litres
None of these

quiz.text: 2 pipes A and B can fill a tank separately in 60 min and 70 min respectively. There is a third pipe attached to the bottom of the tank to empty it. The tank is filled in 60 min when all three pipes are opened. In how much time  (in min.) the third pipe alone take to fill the tank?
options: 110 min
70 min
120 min
90 min
None of these

quiz.text: Two pipes A and B can fill any tank respectively in 37.5 min and 45 min. If both the pipes are opened together, then after how much time should B be closed so that the tank is full in half hours?
options: 15 min
10 min
21 min
9 min
None of these

quiz.text: Three pipes A, B and C can fill a tank in 6 hours. After running them together for two hours the tap C is closed and A and B fills it completely in 7 hours. How much time would C take to fill the tank alone?
options: 7 hours
10.5 hours
14 hours
21 hours
None of these

quiz.text: A water tank has three taps A, B, C. Tap A, when opened, can fill the water tank alone in 4 hours. Tap B, when opened, can filled the water tank alone in 6 hours and tap C, when opened, can empty the water tank alone in 3 hours. If taps A, B and C are opened simultaneously how long will it take to fill the tank completely?
options: 10 hours
8 hours
18 hours
12 hours
None of these

quiz.text: A water tank has two taps A and B. A can fill it in 6 hours, and tap B empty it in 5 hours. If Both the taps open simultaneously the times required to empty the filled tank?
options: 20 hours
30 hours
25 hours
35 hours
None of these

quiz.text: Two pipes can fill a cistern in 14 and 16 h, respectively. The pipes are opened simultaneously and it is found that due to leakage in the bottom, it took 92 min more to fill the cistern. When the cistern is full, in what time will the leak empty it?
options: 43(15/23) h
43(17/23) h
43(13/23) h
43(19/23) h
None of these

quiz.text: A tap having diameter d can empty a tank in 40 min. How long another tap having diameter 2d take to  empty the same tank?
options: 5 min
10 min
20 min
40 min
None of these

quiz.text: A tap having diameter d can empty a tank in 90 min. How long another tap having diameter 3d take to  empty the same tank?
options: 5 min
10 min
20 min
40 min
None of these

quiz.text: Two pipes A and B can fill a cistern in 15 and 20 min, respectively. Both the pipes are opened together, but after 2 min, pipe A is turned off. What is the total time required to fill the tank?
options: 46/3 min
52/3 min
46/3 min
41/3 min.
None of these

quiz.text: Two taps A and B can fill a tank in 20 min and 30 min, respectively. An outlet pipe C can empty the full tank in 15 min. A, B and C are opened alternatively, each for 1 min. How long will the tank take to be filled?
options: 105 min
120 min
167 min
185 min
None of these

quiz.text: A pipe can fill a cistern in 12 min and another pipe can fill it in 15 min, but a third pipe can empty it in 6 min. The first two pipes are kept open for 5 min in the beginning and then the third pipe is also opened. Time taken to empty the cistern is?
options: 38 min
22 min
42 min
45 min
None of these

quiz.text: Taps A, B and C attached with a tank and velocity of water coming through them are 42 L/h, 56 L/h and 48 L/h, respectively. A and B are inlets and C is outlet. If all the taps are opened simultaneously, tank is filled in 16 h. What is the capacity of the tank?
options: 2346 L
1600 L
800 L
960 L
None of these

quiz.text: A boy and girls together fill a cistern with water. The boy pours 4 litres of water every 3 minutes and the girl pours 3 litres every 4 minutes. How much time will it take to fill 100 litres of water in the cistern?
options: 36 minutes
42 minutes
48 minutes
44 minutes
None of these

quiz.text: A tap takes 36 hours extra to fill a tank due to a leakage equivalent to half of its inflow. The inlet pipe alone can fill the tank in how many hours?
options: 36
24
30
18
None of these

quiz.text: Two pipes can separately fill a tank in 20 hrs and 30 hrs respectively. Both the pipes are opened to fill the tank but when the tank is 1/3rd full a leak develops in the tank through which 1/3rd  of the water supplied by both the pipes per hour leak out. What is the total time taken to fill the tank?
options: 12 hrs
14 hrs
16 hrs
18 hrs
None of these

quiz.text: A cistern can be filled by two pipes A and B in 4 hours and 6 hours respectively. When full, the tank can be emptied by a third pipe C in 8 hours. If all the taps be turned on at the same time, the cistern will be full in?
options: 2(2/7) h
3(3/7) h
4(3/7) h
5(5/7) h
None of these

quiz.text: A large cistern can be filled by two pipes P and Q. How many minutes will it take to fill the Cistern from an empty state if Q is used for half the time and P and Q fill it together for the other half?
options: 6.5 minutes
7.5 minutes
8.5 minutes
9.5 minutes
None of the Above

quiz.text: Two pipes M and N can fill a tank. If both the pipes are opened simultaneously, after how much time should N be closed so that the tank is full in 8 minutes?
options: 14 minutes
12 minutes
15 minutes
18 minutes
None of the Above

quiz.text: Three pipe E, F, and R are opened to fill a tank. If Pipe R alone can fill a tank in 24 minutes then the pipe R is closed 12 minutes before the tank is filled . In what time the tank is full?
options: 8.(5/13)
8.(4/13)
7.(4/13)
8.(6/13)
None of these

quiz.text: Two pipes C and D can fill a cistern. If they are opened on alternate minutes and if pipe C is opened first, in how many minutes will the tank be full?
options: 4 minutes
5 minutes
2 minutes
6 minutes
None of the Above

quiz.text: Two pipes, A and B are opened simultaneously and it is found that due to the leakage in the bottom, 17/7 minutes are taken extra to fill the tank. If the tank is full, in what approximate time would the leak empty it?
options: 27 minutes
32 minutes
36 minutes
39 minutes
None of these

quiz.text: A waste pipe, W can carry off 12 litre of water per minute. If all the pipes I, J and W are opened when the tank is full and it takes one hour to empty the tank. Find the capacity of the tank.
options: 30
45
60
75
None of these

quiz.text: Two pipes G, and H are opened and when the tank is 1/3 full a leak is developed due to which 1/3 water supplied by the pipe leaks out. What is the total time to fill the tank?
options: 20/3 minutes
35/3 minutes
40/3 minutes
50/3 minutes
None of these

quiz.text: Two pipes E and F are opened simultaneously and it is found that due to leakage in the bottom of the tank it took 48 minutes excess time to fill the cistern. When the cistern full, in what time will the leak empty it?
options: 72 hours
62 hours
64 hours
84 hours
None of the Above

quiz.text: Three pipes C, A and B are opened to fill a tank. If pipe C is opened all the time and pipe A and B are opened for one hour alternatively. The tank will be full in
options: 5hr
6hr
7hr
8hr
None of these

quiz.text: Three pipes R, P and Q can fill the tank. R can fill the tank 5 hours less than that of Q. If all the pipes are opened together and pipe P is turned off 5 hours before the tank is filled. Then find the time in which the tank will full.
options: 45/11hrs
53/11hrs
51/13hrs
47/11hrs
None of these

quiz.text:
Quantity1- x: Pipe P can fill a tank in 20 hours. Pipe Q can fill the same tank in 25 hours. Pipe P and Pipe Q together can 90% of the tank in x hours.

Quantity2- y: Pipe A usually fills a tank in 2 hours. Because of a leak at the bottom of the tank, it takes pipe A 30 minutes more to fill the tank. if pipe A is shut, then it will take y hours to empty the same tank.
options: Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2

quiz.text:
Quantity1- x: A water tank normally takes 7 hours to be filled by a tap but because of the leak, it takes another 2 hours. In x hours the leak empties a filled water tank.

  Quantity2- y: 1900 minutes.

quiz.text:
Quantity1- x: Two pipes A and B can fill a cistern in 15 hours and 10 hours respectively. A tap C can empty the full cistern in 30 hours. All the three taps were open for 2 hours, when it was remembered that the emptying tap had been left open. It was then closed. We have given that x hours more wil it take for the cistern to be filled.

    Qunatity2- :Pipe A and B can fill a cistern in 10 hours and 15 hours respectively. When a third pipe C which works as an outlet pipe is also open then the cistern can be filled in 18 hours. The outlet pipe can empty a full cistern in y hours.
options: Qunatity1 > Quantity2
Qunatity1 < Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2 or No Relation

quiz.text:
Quantity1- x: Tap A can fill a tank in 20 hours, B in 25 hours but tap C can empty a full tank in 30 hours. Starting with A, followed by B and C each tap opens alternatively for one hour period till the tank gets filled up completely. In x hours the tank will be filled completely.

   Qunatity2- y: 51(7/15)
options: Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2

quiz.text:
Quantity1- x: Pipe A can fill a tank in 4 hour, while pipe B can fill it in 6 hours working separately. Pipe C can empty whole the tank in 4 hours. He opened the pipe A and B simultaneously to fill the empty tank. He wanted to adjust his alarm so that he could open the pipe C when it was half-filled, but he mistakenly adjusted his alarm at a time when his tank would be 3/4th filled. The time difference between both the cases, to fill the tank fully is x min.

Qunatity2- 2.7y: If one pipe A can fill a tank in 20 minutes, then 5 pipes, each of 20% efficiency of A, can fill the tank in y min.
